name: Proyecto Forestal CO2Cero Caucho PL UNO
description: Establecer un proyecto de reforestación comercial, con 10.000 hectáreas de Hevea brasiliensis, para la producción de caucho natural y la participación en los mercados de carbono, con la venta de la reducción de emisiones de GEI, derivada de actividades forestales en los Llanos orientales de Colombia.
participants: Rubberland de Colombia Ltda, Biorecursos S.A.S, Agropecuaria DALI S.A.S, Agromontana S.A.S, Heveas de la Llanura S.A.S., Agrolatex S.A., Invereste S.A.S. y Sifagro Ltda.
localitation: Las áreas del proyecto se localizan los municipios de Puerto Gaitán del departamento de Meta y Cumaribo de Vichada. El área total del proyecto es de 10.000 hectáreas, de las cuales, a diciembre de 2018 se han plantado 2.215,10 hectáreas.

name: Proyecto Forestal CO2Cero Caucho El Viento
description: Establecer un proyecto de reforestación comercial, con 9.500 hectáreas de Hevea brasiliensis, para la producción de caucho natural y la participación en los mercados de carbono, con la venta de la reducción de emisiones de GEI, derivada de actividades forestales en los Llanos orientales de Colombia.
participants: Carimagro S.A.S., Agroforestal El Encanto S.A.S., Vapinsa S.A.S., Agroganadería El Viento S.A., Exro Agrícola RL S.A.S y Agropecuaria Mayoragua S.A.S.
localitation: Las áreas del proyecto se localizan los municipios de Puerto Gaitán del departamento de Meta y Cumaribo de Vichada. El área total del proyecto es de 9.500 hectáreas, de las cuales, a diciembre de 2018 se han plantado 3.083,26 ha.

name: Carbono URANORTE
description: Establecer 201.94 hectáreas de plantaciones forestales comerciales con Tectona grandis y Gmelina arborea en los municipios de Necoclí y San Juan de Urabá (Antioquia)
participants: Finca AquiSi, propiedad de la Cooperativa Teca amigos SAS, quien ha otorgado poder a Juan Camilo Restrepo para la gestión y comercialización de los créditos de carbono, Finca Campo Alegre, propiedad de Forestales para Siempre SAS quien ha otorgado poder a Juan Camilo Restrepo para la gestión y comercialización de los créditos de carbono, Finca La Pradera, propiedad de Juan Camilo Restrepo
localitation: 201,94 hectáreas de plantaciones forestales comerciales con Tectona grandis y Gmelina arborea en los municipios de Necoclí y San Juan de Urabá (Antioquia)

name: Proyecto Forestal CO2Cero Reforestadores Vichada-Meta
description: Establecer un proyecto de reforestación comercial, con 15.000 hectáreas de especies forestales maderables para la producción y la participación en los mercados de carbono, con la venta de la reducción de emisiones de GEI, derivada de actividades forestales en los Llanos orientales de Colombia.
participants: Participantes de la iniciativa Agrolar SAS, Bazim SAS, Agroforestales Bonanza SAS, Carlos Beltrán, Compadres SAS, El Capricho Vichada SAS, Hernán Trujillo, Inversiones Guardabosques de Colombia SAS, La Fortuna Andrea SAS, Punta de Garzas Inversiones Forestales SAS y Terramax SAS.
localitation: Las áreas del proyecto se localizan los municipios de Puerto Lopez del departamento de Meta y Cumaribo, La Primavera y Santa Rosalía de Vichada. El área total del proyecto es de 4.932,46 hectáreas

name: Carbono FOCOLSA
description:
Establecer 95.56 hectáreas de plantaciones forestales comerciales con Pinus maximinoi en el municipio de Gómez Plata.
Generar empleo en el área de influencia del proyecto y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones socioeconómicas del Proyecto
Producir madera de aserrío para venta en centros de transformación cercanos
localitation: 95,56 hectáreas plantadas de Pinus maximinoi Ubicadas en el Municipio de Gómez Plata

name: Proyecto de Conservación Palameku Kuwei REDD+
description: The objectives of the PALAMEKU KUWEI REDD+ Conservation Project are: to mitigate the effects caused by climate change through the adoption of measures for the reduction and the capturing of CO2 emissions, by avoiding deforestation and promoting the restoration of degraded forest territories. To promote the sustainable management of the forests located in the area of influence of the project by forest custodians, by promoting productive activities compatible with the reduction of emissions generated by deforestation. To cooperate in the conservation of biodiversity by protecting the ecological connectivity and habitat of those species that are included in a threat category and those that represent an ecological interest due to their capacity to adapt to climate change. Contribute to gender equity education by increasing the capacity for leadership, participation, empowerment and entrepreneurship of women within the “resguardos indígenas”.
participants: The project proponents are the Cabildos de los Resguardos Indígenas Ríos Muco y Guarrojo, Rios Tomo y Weberi, Punta Bandera, San Luis del Tomo, La Esmeralda and Valdivia, who granted the structuring company BIOFIX CONSULTORIA S.A.S the management of the project document design, as well as the exclusivity for the issuance and marketing of carbon credits generated in the territory, through the temporary association signed between the parties. The project has had as institutional allies the Orinoco Regional Autonomous Corporation - CORPORINOQUIA (where the REDD+ project is registered in the green business window), the Office of Indigenous Affairs of the Cumaribo Municipal Mayor's Office and the Offices of Green and Sustainable Business; and Climate Change and Risk Management of the Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development. Additionally, it is worth mentioning the participation of Conservation International, which has been involved as a strategic manager in the formulation, consolidation, execution and technical evaluation of the project in environmental matters linked to the protection, recovery and defense of biological diversity in the territory.
localitation: The area covered by the project is 32,629 hectares and is located in the collective properties of the Indigenous Reserve Rivers Muco and Guarrojo, rivers Tomo and Weberi, Punta Bandera, San Luis del Tomo, La Esmeralda and Valdivia, located in the Guanape Inspectorates for the first and Tres Matas for the others, located in the northwestern of the municipality of Cumaribo.
ovv: Asociación Española de Normalización AENOR INTERNACIONAL S.A.U.

name: Proyecto de Conservación Delfines Cupica REDD+
description: The DELFINES CUPICA Conservation Project seeks the conservation of the forests located in recognition of the Afro-Colombian communities grouped in the two Community Councils that integrate and propose this project. The specific objectives of the DELFINES CUPICA REDD+ Conservation Project are: to mitigate the effects caused by climate change through the implementation of measures for the reduction and capturing of CO2 emissions, by avoiding deforestation and promoting the restoration of degraded forest territories. To promote the sustainable management of the forests located in the area of influence of the project by forest custodians, by encouraging productive activities well-suited with the reduction of emissions generated by deforestation. To cooperate in the conservation of biodiversity by protecting the ecological connectivity and habitat of those species that are included in a threatened category and those that represent an ecological interest due to their capacity to adapt to climate change, such as sea turtles and mangroves. To contribute to gender equity education by increasing the capacity for leadership, participation, empowerment and entrepreneurship of women within the Community Councils.
participants: The project proponents are the General Community Council of the Northern Pacific Coast of Chocó "Los Delfines" and the Cupica Community Council, who granted the structuring company BIOFIX CONSULTORÍA S.A.S., the management of the project document design, as well as the exclusivity for the issuance and marketing of carbon credits generated in the territory. The project has had as institutional allies the Corporación Autónoma Regional para el Desarrollo Sostenible del Chocó - CODECHOCO (where the REDD+ project is registered in the Ventanilla de Emprendimientos Verdes) and the Instituto de Investigaciones Ambientales del Pacífico - IIAP.
localitation: The area covered by the project is 113,025 hectares and is located in the properties of the collective territories awarded to the Consejos Comunitarios General Costa Pacífica Norte del Chocó "Los Delfines" y de Cupica.
ovv: Asociación Española de Normalización AENOR INTERNACIONAL S.A.U.

name: Proyecto de compensación de emisiones Conservación del bosque Galilea-Amé
description: The Galilea Forest Conservation REDD+ Project Amé, has the main objective to preserve the region's native forests by reducing Greenhouse Gas (GHG) emissions caused by deforestation and degradation, also preserving and protecting local biodiversity through inter-institutional programs and initiatives, the development of activities that promote CO2 emissions reduction, execution of social strategies with the purpose of maintaining these forests in a state of conservation. From a biophysical perspective, the region where the project is located (Department of Tolima) characterizes itself by having a high diversity of fauna and flora distributed in different types of ecosystems, as well as a large supply of water resources. In addition these forests are part of the priority areas for conservation in the Andean and Amazonian region, since they are located in the biological corridor that connects the Andean and High Andean forests with the Sumapaz Paramo, National Natural Park and the Galilea Forest Regional Natural Park. It is the last relict of primary forest in eastern Tolima which contains the river Río Negro, main source of the Hidro Prado dam that generates and supplies clean energy to most of the local communities.
participants: Fundación Fundame.Col, Ecocarbono SAS ZOMAC Universidad del Tolima
localitation: The project area has 13,727 hectares of forest located in Villarrica, Tolima.
ovv: Asociación Española de Normalización AENOR INTERNACIONAL S.A.U.

name: Proyecto de Mitigación Forestal Resguardo Indígena TICOYA
description: The Tikuna, Cocama, and Yagua Indigenous Reserve Forest Mitigation Project (TICOYA) is a local initiative of the Association of Indigenous Authorities ATICOYA. The project seeks the certification of actions related to the reduction of carbon emissions due to unplanned deforestation in around 131,531.7 ha of dense forests belonging to the TICOYA Indigenous Reserve, located in the municipalities of Puerto Nariño and Leticia (Amazonas). The Project expects the reduction of 2,263,951 tCO2e through the implementation of activities related to five strategic lines, recovery, and rehabilitation of forests; sustainable agricultural production and business projects; strengthening of food security through traditional production systems (chagras), monitoring, and strengthening of governance.
participants: Resguardo Indígena Tikuna, Cocama y Yagua (TICOYA), South Pole Carbon Asset Management S.A.S
localitation: 141841.3 ha. TICOYA Indigenous Reserve, in the municipalities of Puerto Nariño and Leticia, Amazonas Department, Colombia.
ovv: Asociación Española de Normalización AENOR INTERNACIONAL S.A.U.

name: Proyecto Forestal CO2CERO Meta09
description:
El proyecto forestal CO2CERO Meta_09 está constituido, inicialmente, por cultivos de caucho en el predio de Industrias y Plantaciones S.A.S.
El proyecto forestal CO2CERO Meta_09 contempla una proyección de 12.500 hectáreas, considerando el potencial para la venta de bonos de carbono, con base en la actual normatividad relacionada con la mitigación del cambio climático, y vinculado al interés de los reforestadores, de participar en proyectos de desarrollo forestal en la región. El área plantada, a abril de 2019 alcanza 300,43 hectáreas.
participants: La empresa Industrias y Plantaciones S.A.S, por medio de su representante legal Tomás Echeverry Fajardo.
localitation: La actividad forestal se desarrolla en El predio El Garabato, localizado en el paraje La Conquista, del municipio de Mapiripán, departamento del Meta. El predio completa una extensión de 1.179,6 ha. Las actividades del proyecto se desarrollan en 300,43 ha de área elegible.

name: Proyecto de Conservación Tángara REDD+
description: The Tángara REDD+ Conservation Project pursues the conservation of the ecosystems (mangrove and high dense forest) in the private properties of Playa Chuchas (real estate registration No. 372-20568) and Lomas de Auca (idem No. 372-20569); which equal in total 14.200 legal hectares. Both of them are located in the Municipality of Buenaventura, Department Valle del Cauca, Colombia. Their objectives are to (i) mitigate climate change by reducing CO2 emissions by avoiding deforestation and forest degradation, (ii) contribute to the conservation of biodiversity by protecting the habitat of endangered species, (iii) promote the sustainable development of forest custodians located in the project area by implementing productive activities well-suited for the reduction of deforestation emissions, through training and technical assistance.
participants: Tángara Forest Zomac S.A.S. and Biofix Consultoría S.A.S.
localitation: 14,200 hectares, located in the Municipality of Buenaventura, Department of Valle del Cauca, Colombia.

name: Proyecto Forestal MAVALLE en plantaciones de Caucho natural
description: The Mavalle Project is an AFOLU mitigation project of the reforestation type (ARR). The project consists of planting 8,736 hectares of Hevea brasiliensis with a focus on latex extraction for rubber production. The plantations are divided into 11 farms previously used for livestock activity, in the municipalities of Puerto López and Puerto Gaitán, in the department of Meta
participants: Carbo Sostenible S.A.S., FONCAP, y Sociedad Mavalle
localitation: Puerto López and Puerto Gaitán, Meta department. Colombia.

name: Proyecto de Conservación Kaliawiri REDD+
description: Within the Orinoco-Amazon transition zone, seven “Resguardos indigenas” of the Sikuani and Piapoco tribes in the departments of Guainía and Vichada, allied with BIOFIX in the KALIAWIRI REDD+ Project, are working to ensure the conservation of the 358.000 hectares of tropical rainforest forests they own within their communities. To this end, they have defined as cross line of action educational processes in forest governance, entrepreneurship, gender equality, rescue of ancestral cultural traditions, and territorial delineation; reforestation and community monitoring; implementation of renewable energies and improvement of infrastructure in communications, mobility, health and recreation, technification of productive processes carried out by the communities for self-sufficiency and marketing of products based of cocoa, chili, yucca, sweet yucca, pineapple, sugar cane, cereals, as well as the incorporation of sustainability in the use of silvopastoral systems, fishing and non-timber forest products such as Moriche, Seje and Caucho.
participants: BIOFIX Consultancy SAS and the Resguardos indígenas Cali Barranquilla, Concordia, Chocón, Flores Sombrero, Guaco Bajo and Guaco Alto, Río Siare Barranco Lindo, Saracure Río Cadá, Fauna & Flora Kumali'bo SAS
localitation: 358,065 ha in the lands awarded to the seven indigenous reserves located in the southeast of the municipality of Cumaribo (Vichada) and the northeast of the municipality of Puerto Inírida (Guainía).
ovv: Asociación Española de Normalización AENOR INTERNACIONAL S.A.U.

name: Proyecto de Conservación YAAWI IIPANA REDD+
description: In the Amazon biome, the resguardo indígena “Morichal Viejo, Santa Rosa, Cerro Cocuy, Santa Cruz, Caño Danta  y otros”, proposed the YAAWI IIPANA REDD+ Project, which translates as "the house of Jaguar" in Curripaco, one of the predominant languages of the communities that make up the resguardo, in reference to the jaguar, that is one of the protective animals of their territory according to their cosmovision and one of the emblems of the conservation processes in Latin America, as it is the largest feline in the region catalogued as a threatened species by the IUCN. This project protects 248.046 hectares of the Amazon Forest region and seeks to minimize the impact generated by deforestation and forest degradation through a comprehensive vision of territorial development, following the guidelines dictated by the community in a General Assembly and reflected in its 20-year Life Project, which in Spanish is called “Plan de Vida”, These include initiatives related to the reforestation of degraded ecosystems and social monitoring with forest custodians, the strengthening of the agricultural-productive sector and self-sufficiency with the improvement of chagras and the enhancement of products such as chili, yucca brava, corn and plantain; strengthening governance and creating an indigenous guard, building educational institutions, health posts and common room, supporting students to access higher education, improving housing and transportation.
participants: On one hand, Biofix Consultoría SAS acts as the allied company that carries out the structuring of the Project and manages the commercialization of the VCUs. On the other hand, as project proponent and collective property tenure, is the Resguardo Indígena Morichal Viejo, Santa Rosa, Cerro Cocuy, Santa Cruz, Caño Danta  y otros, created and recognized by Resolution 045 of November 30, 1998 issued by INCORA
localitation: El Retorno and San José del Guaviare municipalities, located in the department of Guaviare, in the northern region of the Amazon biome, in southeastern Colombia.
ovv: Asociación Española de Normalización AENOR INTERNACIONAL S.A.U.

name: CO2Bio
description: This project aims to conserve biodiversity in forest areas presents in a group of private properties in the Orinoquia region of Colombia, through the implementation of activities seeking to increase forest cover, mitigate land-use degradation and decrease pressures due to habitat loss, in order to maintain the forests' capacity to supply the ecosystems the capacity of forests to provide goods and services and better adapt to possible effects of climate change.
participants:
FUNDACIÓN CATARUBEN
PROGRAMA RIQUEZA NATURAL DE USAID
LANDOWNERS
localitation: Casanare, Arauca, and Vichada departments, Colombia.
ovv: Asociación Española de Normalización AENOR INTERNACIONAL S.A.U.

name: Más Bosques para Medellín
description: The Forestry project proposed – More Forests for Medellín – is based on the establishment of forest plantations, silvopastoral systems, and models for assisted natural regeneration (ANR) in grassland and stubble areas in the Municipality of Medellín, in the department of Antioquia (6° 13´ 55.098 ´´ N and 75° 34´ 05.752 ´´ W), a municipality with a total area of 382 km2 . The aim is to promote the removal of greenhouse gases (GHG) and mitigate the effects of climate change, having taken into account the socio-economic and cultural traditions of the population in the area of influence of the project. The area of influence of the project is characterized by being located within the limits of the urban area of the city of Medellín and includes the natural landscapes (green areas) that belong to the tutelary hills located within the urban area.
participants:
Municipio de Medellín
Reforestadora Integral de Antioquia
South Pole Carbon Asset Management

name: PROYECTO DE CARBONO FORESTAL ORGANIZACIÓN LA PRIMAVERA
description:
The project is located in the municipality of La Primavera (Department of Vichada, in the eastern plains of Colombia). The project involves reforestation with commercial forest species and, at the same time, the recovery and improvement of the remaining natural forests and gallery forests under passive restoration actions. 
The commercial forest species considered for reforestation are Pinus caribaea and Eucalyptus pellita, in an area of 519.6 ha.

name: Proyecto Forestal Fundación Obra Social Redentorista Señor de los Milagros
holder_name: Fundación Obra Social Redentorista Señor de los Milagros
description:
Reforestation with commercial species, promoting the recovery and improvement of the remaining natural forests.
The project's actions are focused on protecting ecosystems and areas of special ecological interest that for years had been dedicated to extensive grazing, continuous cutting and burning of pastures and savannah areas.
The areas within the project boundaries correspond to 1,186.33 ha of P. caribaea, 113.85 ha of E. pellita, 1.69 ha of A. mangium and 7.84 ha of S. amara, the latter species is planted for restoration purposes.
For the passive regeneration zones, everything is focused on ceasing actions that inhibit the growth of the native forest, i.e. removing grazing and eliminating the cutting and burning of pastures, allowing the successional process of the forest to continue. Similarly, water sources are protected, allowing the gallery forest to increase its area, forming connectivity corridors.
participants: Fundación Obra Social Redentorista Señor de los Milagros
localitation: The project is located in the municipality of La Primavera, Department of Vichada, in the eastern plains of Colombia.

name: DABUCURY REDD+
holder_name: Carbo Sostenible S.A.S y Terra Commodities S.A.S.
description: The project seeks to contribute to the sustainable development of the communities and preserve the existing forests in the territory of the Vuelta del Alivio Indigenous Reservation, the Yavilla II Indigenous Reservation and the Lagos El Dorado, Lagos del Paso and El Remanso Indigenous Reservations, through the strengthening of territorial governance by the indigenous people, the development of sustainable productive activities compatible with nature that contribute to food security and the generation of surpluses, the monitoring and protection of biodiversity and local cultural values.
participants:
R.I. Vuelta del Alivio
R.I. Yavilla II
R.I. Lagos del Dorado, Lagos del Paso y El Remanso
CARBO Sostenible SAS
TERRA Commodities SAS
